intro: Areca normanbyi, commonly known as the Normanby’s areca, is a species of palm native to the tropical regions of northern Australia. It is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and pinnate leaves that can reach several meters in length. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences with both male and female flowers, typical of many palm species. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires a warm, humid climate. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and landscapes in tropical and subtropical areas.
